text: Lithocarpus echinifer is a tree in the beech family Fagaceae. The specific epithet ' is from the Latin meaning "having straight spines", referring to the cupule. ==Description== Lithocarpus echinifer grows as a tree up to tall with a trunk diameter of up to . The greyish brown bark is fissured or smooth. The coriaceous leaves measure up to long. Its brown acorns are almost hemispherical and measure up to across. ==Distribution and habitat== Lithocarpus echinifer is endemic to Borneo. Its habitat is dipterocarp forests up to altitude. ==References== echinifer Category:Endemic flora of Borneo Category:Trees of Borneo Category:Plants described in 1929
title: Lithocarpus echinifer
